ALL DAY - ROUTES 9R, 22 FILLMORE, 24 DIVISADERO, 57 PARK MERCED

TITLE: Muni Subway Nightly Shutdown at 10 PM: July 31, 2015 - January 2016
DETAILS:
Starting Friday, July 31, 2015 until January 2016, the SFMTA will be replacing the Blue Light emergency telephones and radio communications system in the Muni Metro subway between Embarcadero and West Portal. The work will be done as part of the Muni Subway Upgrade Projects, which encompasses Blue Light Emergency Telephone Replacement, Radio Replacement and Twin Peaks Tunnel Track Replacement projects.

As a result of the project, Muni subway services will be shutdown every night at 10PM until the start of morning service. The nightly shutdown begins on Friday, July 31, 2015 and will continue through January 2016.

What to expect during construction

  • Construction will require early subway shutdowns nightly from 10 p.m. until start of service in the morning.
  • During the shutdowns, bus shuttles will provide substitution service between Embarcadero and St. Francis Circle from 9:30 p.m. to 1:30 a.m. Regular rail service will continue to operate at all outer stops.
  • To ensure that the tunnel is clear, depending on where you catch the train, service might end as early as 9:30 p.m. (example: Embarcadero to clear as early as 9:30, whereas Castro last train may be at 9:45).
  • Muni Metro customers can board bus shuttles at the island F Line stops adjacent to subway stations on Market Street. Bus s huttle will make regular stops between West Portal and St. Francis Circle.

For more information, please visit www.sfmta.com/subwayupgrades

TITLE: Civic Center Station platform elevator out of service
DETAILS: Per station agent, Glen, the Civic Center Station platform elevator is out of service.

TITLE: APTA (American Public Transportation Association) MEETING 10/4 THRU 10/7 - all  participants using Clipper Cards
DETAILS:
The APTA meeting will take place in San Francisco from October 4, 2015 thru October 7, 2015.

All APTA attendees will be issued Clipper Cards loaded with an "EVENTS PASS".  This Clipper Card is good for all modes of transport including Cable Cars.  Attendees will be instructed on how to tag their cars as they enter a bus, metro station, or board a Cable Car.  Instructions from John Haley state for attendees that fail to properly tag their clipper cards - their APTA meeting Badges should be honored for boarding any Muni vehicle and entrance to Muni paid areas.
